title.narrative: 1.21 SANITATION

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development and Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)

WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: Significant progress was made towards achieving universal toilet access, and increased toilet use aimed at improving children&39;s health. UNICEF&39;s technical support to the Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) in policy formulation, planning, implementation, data analysis and research focused on a district-wide approach covering households, institutions and public places. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of sates achieving an acceleration in sanitation coverage to at least 6% a year from 2015 - 2017

target.value: 2017:All states achieving an annual 6.2% increase in coverage for 2017

title.narrative: Percentage of delivery points in HPDS having functional WASH facilities in labour room and delivery wards

target.value: 2016:65% of delivery points in HPDS have functional WASH facilities in Labour room and delivery wards of identified Health facilities by the end of 2016

title.narrative: Proportion of districts in UNICEF present states that have designed and are implementing social and behaviour change communication strategies

target.value: 2016:30% of districts in UNICEF present states have designed and are implementing social and behaviour change communication strategies by end of 2016

title.narrative: Proportion of districts in UNICEF present states implementing policies to reduce open defecation

target.value: 2016:30% of districts in UNICEF present states implementing policies to reduce open defecation by the end of 2016

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation as a result of UNICEF and partner support (leveraged/indirect)

baseline.value: Not all states are achieving an annual 6.2% increase in coverage

target.value: 2017:13 states are achieving an annual 6.2% increase in coverage for 2017
